intro: Parnassia noemiae, commonly known as the silverweed or white crowfoot, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Ranunculaceae. It is characterized by its striking white, star-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are compound, with a distinctive silver-white underside that gives it its common name. Parnassia noemiae is valued for its ornamental beauty and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
